A.storyText: The thug is so focused on his target he doesn't notice Rhonin.

B.storyText: Agmar's reactions are quick. He counters his first attack.

C.storyText: There is. The guards must have been close, because their stepps echoed on the street right after his alert.

D.storyText: The thug is so focused on his target he doesn't notice Rhonin.

A.storyText: The wolves are clearly not interested in chasing him as his bag smells way better.

B.storyText: The wolves are running away in fear as their prey turns out to be a hunter.

C.storyText: Besides the lack of meat he brought, and some hours of patching, he could continue his journay as nothing happened

D.storyText: The wolves are running in fear as their prey turns out to be a hunter.

A.storyText: Though his disappointment was great when he realized Rhonin's intention, it eased after the day he could spend watching Rhonin sit alone in a dank cell

C.storyText: Sneka couldn't have done it better. Rhonin disappeared as the fog in sunrise.

D.storyText: Who needs hiding if there's opportunity to give the soldiers reason to call themselves the hand of justice. These hands held tight that poor thief, while Rhonin didn't stop to catch flies as most.

A.storyText: He is asked to do things to himself that would normally require two adults. The other option includes ropes and much violance. Rhonin won't get in.

B.storyText: The doorman assures him, he won't get inside alive. Not even if he has an army backing him.

C.storyText: Rhonin fought well, but drawing the whole place's attention is not the way to get in silently. He missed this opportunity, now eyes are watching him leave.

D.storyText:
Rhonin is inside and arriving just in time to catch Sneka.
-I hoped not to run into you my friend. Happy to see you though.
-What are you hiding?
-Sorry, Rhonin. I would have seeked your help if there would be any hope. The best you can do is to hide. Hide as we did in the old times. Hide as I showed.
-Don't go in circles. Tell me what's in the air!
-Louder! They don't hear you yet........eh, the council. The wizard council turns out to be more or less warlock council? I don't know these ranks, types, categories, but one for sure. They found an ancient scroll of some sort. They want to bring back to life something, a beast that should never ever again roam these lands. Pack up and run, they cannot be stopped now.
-Thank you. Once again, I owe you.
-You bet! I won't forget it.

C.storyText:
-Can't you read? What do you want?
-Answers! What is happening in West-Wirmgold?
-They summoned the ultimate evil. Just a matter of time when they are going to lose control over it. If not did already. Don't look for me anymore. I'm invisible from now!

D.storyText: He should be doing something though.
